net.opentsdb.tree

Class TreeRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.opentsdb.tree.TreeRule

  • public final class TreeRule
extends Object
    Represents single rule in a set of rules for a given tree. Each rule is uniquely identified by:
    • tree_id - The ID of the tree to which the rule belongs
    • level - Outer processing order where the rule resides. Lower values are processed first. Starts at 0.
    • order - Inner processing order within a given level. Lower values are processed first. Starts at 0.
    Each rule is stored as an individual column so that they can be modified individually. RPC calls can also bulk replace rule sets.
    Since:
    2.0

      • copyChanges

        public boolean copyChanges(TreeRule rule,
                           boolean overwrite)
        Copies changed fields from the incoming rule to the local rule
        Parameters:
        rule - The rule to copy from
        overwrite - Whether or not to replace all fields in the local object
        Returns:
        True if there were changes, false if everything was identical

      • syncToStorage

        public com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<Boolean> syncToStorage(TSDB tsdb,
                                                             boolean overwrite)
        Attempts to write the rule to storage via CompareAndSet, merging changes with an existing rule. Note: If the local object didn't have any fields set by the caller or there weren't any changes, then the data will not be written and an exception will be thrown. Note: This method also validates the rule, making sure that proper combinations of data exist before writing to storage.
        Parameters:
        tsdb - The TSDB to use for storage access
        overwrite - When the RPC method is PUT, will overwrite all user accessible fields
        Returns:
        True if the CAS call succeeded, false if the stored data was modified in flight. This should be retried if that happens.
        Throws:
        org.hbase.async.HBaseException - if there was an issue
        IllegalArgumentException - if parsing failed or the tree ID was invalid or validation failed
        IllegalStateException - if the data hasn't changed. This is OK!
        JSONException - if the object could not be serialized

      • parseFromStorage

        public static TreeRule parseFromStorage(org.hbase.async.KeyValue column)
        Parses a rule from the given column. Used by the Tree class when scanning a row for rules.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to parse
        Returns:
        A valid TreeRule object if parsed successfully
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the column was empty
        JSONException - if the object could not be serialized

      • fetchRule

        public static com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<TreeRule> fetchRule(TSDB tsdb,
                                                                 int tree_id,
                                                                 int level,
                                                                 int order)
        Attempts to retrieve the specified tree rule from storage.
        Parameters:
        tsdb - The TSDB to use for storage access
        tree_id - ID of the tree the rule belongs to
        level - Level where the rule resides
        order - Order where the rule resides
        Returns:
        A TreeRule object if found, null if it does not exist
        Throws:
        org.hbase.async.HBaseException - if there was an issue
        IllegalArgumentException - if the one of the required parameters was missing
        JSONException - if the object could not be serialized

      • deleteRule

        public static com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<Object> deleteRule(TSDB tsdb,
                                                                int tree_id,
                                                                int level,
                                                                int order)
        Attempts to delete the specified rule from storage
        Parameters:
        tsdb - The TSDB to use for storage access
        tree_id - ID of the tree the rule belongs to
        level - Level where the rule resides
        order - Order where the rule resides
        Returns:
        A deferred without meaning. The response may be null and should only be used to track completion.
        Throws:
        org.hbase.async.HBaseException - if there was an issue
        IllegalArgumentException - if the one of the required parameters was missing

      • deleteAllRules

        public static com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<Object> deleteAllRules(TSDB tsdb,
                                                                    int tree_id)
        Attempts to delete all rules belonging to the given tree.
        Parameters:
        tsdb - The TSDB to use for storage access
        tree_id - ID of the tree the rules belongs to
        Returns:
        A deferred to wait on for completion. The value has no meaning and may be null.
        Throws:
        org.hbase.async.HBaseException - if there was an issue
        IllegalArgumentException - if the one of the required parameters was missing
